title: Ticket #5085: Need std::string Sinful::human_friendly() const
description:
There should be a function, perhaps part of class Sinful, that takes a Sinful and returns something "human friendly," with a particular eye toward terseness. Sacrifices can be made for the representation; it will lose information and it won't be parseable. It is not appropriate for log messages where important information for debugging may be lost. This is just for the convenience of a quick scan by users.

knoeller is implementing a simple version for condor_q; it will just replace everything after the question mark with "...". We at least want to do things like ignoring the primary address/port in favor what we find in addrs if addrs is present. I suggest eliminating the <angle brackets>, as the result isn't really a Sinful.

This is for things like condor_q, whose default output used to start with nice short things like 

  -- Submitter: foo.example.com : <192.168.0.55:35706> : foo.example.com

but now can look like (in a fairly complex but not extreme case) 

  -- Submitter: foo.example.com : <192.168.0.55:35706?addrs=192.168.0.55:35706+[fe80::abcd:1234:0001:1010]:35706&sock=collector&PrivAddr=%3c10.0.0.1:35706%3e&PrivNet=ExampleLand> : foo.example.com

and I propose to turn that into something like 

  -- Submitter: foo.example.com : [fe80::abcd:1234:0001:1010]:35706 : foo.example.com
creator: adesmet
